summary: The Arab League is a group of 22 Arab countries that started in 1945. Its goal is to help members work together, protect their independence, and think about what's best for Arab countries. They have programs for politics, the economy, culture, science, and social issues. The league helps members solve problems and has created important documents to make the Arab economy stronger. Each country gets one vote, and decisions are only official if everyone agrees. In 2015, they made a plan for a joint military force to fight extremism.
title: Arab League
